metadata.title: CVE-2022-21385 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw in net_rds_alloc_sgs() in Oracle Linux kernels allows unprivilegedlocal users to crash the machine. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 6.2 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector (CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21385` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1043-kvm - 4.15.0-1043.43
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1043.43').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49').
